instruction: What metric was chosen to evaluate the extraction accuracy in the related study on the assessment of rice distribution for mountain rice in complex terrain, and how far can this metric go?
Output:
The metric chosen to evaluate the extraction accuracy in this study is the overall accuracy (OA). The OA measures the percentage of correctly classified samples out of the total number of samples. It provides an overall assessment of the classification performance.

However, it is important to note that the OA alone may not provide a comprehensive evaluation of the classification performance. It does not consider the specific errors made by the classifier, such as false positives and false negatives. Therefore, while the OA can give a general idea of the accuracy, it may not capture the complete picture of the classifier's performance. Other metrics such as the Kappa coefficient and F1 score were also used in this study to provide additional insights into the performance of the classification scheme.

instruction: How did the use of multitemporal feature combinations improve the overall accuracy of rice extraction in this study on the assessment of rice distribution using remote sensing technology for mountain rice in complex terrain?

This means that by combining different features from different time periods, the classification algorithm was able to better distinguish and accurately identify mountain rice in complex terrain.
